    level="1"
    right="Feat 4"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Poultice Preparation](/Feats.aspx?ID=6341) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=535" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 202 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Archetype** [Herbalist](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=252)

**Prerequisites**
[Herbalist Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=6339)

</column>

---

When you create an [elixir](/Traits.aspx?ID=589) as an herbal item, you can prepare it as a poultice instead. A poultice gains the [oil](/Traits.aspx?ID=663) trait (but remains [alchemical](/Traits.aspx?ID=528), not [magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=644)) and loses the elixir trait. You can apply a poultice by [Interacting](/Actions.aspx?ID=2297) with one hand. When you apply a poultice, in addition to the item’s normal effects, the recipient can attempt an immediate flat check to recover from a single source of [persistent](/Conditions.aspx?ID=86) acid, bleed, or fire damage, with the DC reduction from appropriate assistance.
name: Poultice Preparation
